Uses of Class
nl.esciencecenter.octopus.files.Pathname

  • Packages that use Pathname 
    Package Description
    nl.esciencecenter.octopus.files
    This package contains classes and interfaces for manipulating files.

    • Uses of Pathname in nl.esciencecenter.octopus.files

      Methods in nl.esciencecenter.octopus.files that return Pathname 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Pathname Pathname.getFileName()
      Get the file name, or null if the pathname is empty.
      Pathname Pathname.getName(int index)
      Get a name element of this path.
      Pathname Pathname.getParent()
      Get the parent path, or null if this path does not have a parent.
      Pathname Path.getPathname()
      Get the Pathname on the FileSystem.
      Pathname Pathname.normalize()
      Normalize this pathname by removing as many redundant path elements as possible.
      Pathname Pathname.relativize(Pathname other)
      Create a relative path between the given path and this path.
      Pathname Pathname.resolve(Pathname other)
      Resolve a pathname against this path.
      Pathname Pathname.resolve(String other)
      Resolve a String containing a pathname against this path.
      Pathname Pathname.resolveSibling(Pathname other)
      Resolves the given path to this paths parent path, thereby creating a sibling to this path.
      Pathname Pathname.subpath(int beginIndex, int endIndex)
      Returns a pathname that is a subsequence of the name elements of this path.
      Methods in nl.esciencecenter.octopus.files that return types with arguments of type Pathname 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Iterator<Pathname> Pathname.iterator()
      Create an Iterator that returns all possible sub paths of this path, in order of increasing length.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Pathname.endsWith(Pathname other)
      Tests if this path ends with the given path.
      Path Files.newPath(FileSystem filesystem, Pathname location)
      Create a new Path that represents a (possibly non existing) location on filesystem.
      Pathname Pathname.relativize(Pathname other)
      Create a relative path between the given path and this path.
      Pathname Pathname.resolve(Pathname other)
      Resolve a pathname against this path.
      Pathname Pathname.resolveSibling(Pathname other)
      Resolves the given path to this paths parent path, thereby creating a sibling to this path.
      boolean Pathname.startsWith(Pathname other)
      Tests if this path starts with the given path.
      Constructors in nl.esciencecenter.octopus.files with parameters of type Pathname 
      Constructor and Description
      Pathname(Pathname... paths)
      Create a new pathname by appending the provided paths.
